Oh, really? I got some sites for you look up, I think
you might want a piece of paper to these sites down.
They're really good sites. 
h:ttp//www.shirofan.com/english.html
h:ttp//www.ki.rim.or.jp/~castle/photo_library/shimabara_jou.htm
h:ttp//infoweb.magi.com/~ttyoka/oshiro/
h:ttp//www.castlesontheweb.com/search/Castle_Tours/Japan

--- Herb Lison <HerbLison@...> wrote:
> Unfortunately the current Osaka castle is a modern
> reconstruction and only
> a pale imitation of the one built by Hideyoshi in
> the late 1500s.  Although
> many historical structures were destroyed in WWII,
> there are still
> a number of castles that are more or less "original"
> construction,
> with a limited amount of restoration work over the
> years.  
> The most famous to westerners is Himeji, sometimes
> called
> the "White Heron" castle.   However there are many
> others, including
> my personal favorite, Inuyama, a tiny jewel of a
> castle on the Kiso River,
> north of Nagoya.
> 
> andrea Smith wrote:
> 
> > I have seen how the Japanese castles were built, I
> > would like to see some pictures of some really
> amazing
> > Japanese castles, like Osaka Castle. In 1614 and
> 1615,
> > that castle I mentioned was invaded by Tokugawa
> Ieyasu
> > before he died in 1616.
> >
